body_html:
@neale I don't believe anyone has tried to get tfcompile / tf_library to work on Windows.

Honestly I'm not even sure what the right approach should be; on linux we rely on the tf_library bazel macro to kick off tfcompile binary, but I'm not sure whether this will fly on Windows. In the worst case, as long as we can get the tfcompile binary built, the user can invoke it themselves. I'll self-assign and follow-up to figure out how to best do this.

@neale I don't believe anyone has tried to get tfcompile / tf_library to work on Windows.
Honestly I'm not even sure what the right approach should be; on linux we rely on the tf_library bazel macro to kick off tfcompile binary, but I'm not sure whether this will fly on Windows.  In the worst case, as long as we can get the tfcompile binary built, the user can invoke it themselves.  I'll self-assign and follow-up to figure out how to best do this.
body:
@neale I don't believe anyone has tried to get `tfcompile` / `tf_library` to work on Windows.

Honestly I'm not even sure what the right approach should be; on linux we rely on the `tf_library` bazel macro to kick off `tfcompile` binary, but I'm not sure whether this will fly on Windows.  In the worst case, as long as we can get the `tfcompile` binary built, the user can invoke it themselves.  I'll self-assign and follow-up to figure out how to best do this.
